question: Match List-I with List-II:
List-I (Types of redox reactions): a. Combination, b. Decomposition, c. Displacement, d. Disproportionation
List-II (Examples):
i. <katex>$Cl_{2(g)}+2Br_{(aq)}^{-} \rightarrow 2Cl_{(aq)}^{-}+Br_{2(l)}$</katex>
ii. <katex>$2H_{2}O_{2(aq)} \rightarrow 2H_{2}O_{(l)}+O_{2(g)}$</katex>
iii. <katex>$CH_{4(g)}+2O_{2(g)} \rightarrow CO_{2(g)}+2H_{2}O_{(l)}$</katex>
iv. <katex>$2H_{2}O_{(l)} \rightarrow 2H_{2(g)}+O_{2(g)}$</katex>
explanation: a. Combination: <katex>$CH_4 + 2O_2 \rightarrow CO_2 + 2H_2O$</katex> (combining with oxygen, combustion is a type). Note: Answer key maps a-iii.
d. Disproportionation: <katex>$H_2O_2$</katex> decomposes to water and oxygen (ii).
